12 Nov 2008

Modern Childhood

By in category

I’m here to stand up for children and childhood. Parents, I understand your modern aesthetic. Everything has to be minimal. Your couches are white and your children are kept prisoner in the basement so their dirty little fingers don’t mess with your oh-so-zen decor. Okay, fine.

Well people, this is where I draw the line. I was willing to stomach the new child-sized Starck Ghost Chair, but now I’m pissed. Let me put it plainly,  if you find yourself craving this $100  Bruno Limberger-designed ash-wood coin bank from Design Within Reach, we need to have a little talk.

I feel a little like Chris Farley, but I’ll say it anyway:  “FOR GOD SAKES, LET THE KID HAVE A PIGGY BANK!” And by the way, please get over yourself.

Thank you,

The Association for the Preservation of Childhood

About us

Hypenotic is a marketing strategy, design & development firm that chooses to use its powers for good. We’re a certified founding member of B Corp in Canada. Since ’98, we’ve helped a lot of interesting people do important things. We create relevant communications and useful experiences. Find out more.
